de.jackwhite20.japs.client.sub

Interface Subscriber

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SubscriberImpl

    public interface Subscriber
    Created by JackWhite20 on 25.03.2016.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connected()
      Returns if the subscriber is connected.
      void disconnect(boolean force)
      Disconnects the publisher.
      boolean hasSubscription(java.lang.String channel)
      Checks if the given channel is subscribed.

      Returns the name of the subscriber.

      Subscribes a channel and sets the handler for it.

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(boolean force)
        Disconnects the publisher. If you are not forcing a disconnect, this method will block until the reconnect was successful.
        Parameters:
        force - If true, the subscriber will not try to reconnect

      • hasSubscription

        boolean hasSubscription(java.lang.String channel)
        Checks if the given channel is subscribed.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to check.
        Returns:
        True if it is subscribed, otherwise false.

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(java.lang.String channel,
               java.lang.Class<? extends ChannelHandler> handler)
        Subscribes a channel and sets the handler for it. If the channel is already subscribed, the channel handler will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to subscribe to.
        handler - The handler which is responsible for the messages received in that channel.

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(java.lang.Class<? extends ChannelHandler> handler)
        Subscribes a channel and sets the handler for it. The class must have a Channel annotation with the channel the class is responsible for. If the channel is already subscribed, the channel handler will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler which is responsible for the messages received in that channel.

      • subscribeMulti

        void subscribeMulti(java.lang.Class<?> handler)
        Subscribes a channel and sets the multi handler for it. The class must have a Channel annotation with the channel the class is responsible for. If the channel is already subscribed, the multi channel handler will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler which is responsible for the messages received in that channel and the key value method matches.

      • unsubscribe

        void unsubscribe(java.lang.String channel)
        Unsubscribe a channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to unsubscribe.

      • connected

        boolean connected()
        Returns if the subscriber is connected.
        Returns:
        True if connected, otherwise false.

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        Returns the name of the subscriber.
        Returns:
        The name.
